Source: vignettes/MISTy.Rmd
MISTy.Rmd

Introduction

The use of MISTy is conceptualized around building a workflow for analysis using four classes of functions:

  • View composition

  • Train models

  • Result processing

  • Plotting

library(MISTy)
#> MISTy is able to run computationally intensive functions
#>   in parallel. Please consider specifying a future::plan(). For example by running 
#>   future::plan(future::multisession) before calling MISTy functions.
library(magrittr)

MISTy is designed with the use of pipe operators (for example the operator %>% from magrittr) to construct a workflow by chaining functions in mind.

When loading MISTy please consider configuring a future::multisession() parallel execution plan. MISTy will then use all available cores for execution of computationally demanding functions. It is recommended that the user modifies the future::plan() according to their needs.
